t: Psalm 50
A Psalm of Asaph.
The*p mighty God, even the Lord,*s hath spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun unto the going down thereof.
Out*p of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God hath shined.
Our*p God shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall devour before him, and it shall be very tempestuous round about him.
He*p shall call to the heavens from above, and to the earth, that he may judge his people.
Gather*p my saints together unto me; those that have made a covenant with me by sacrifice.
And*p the heavens shall declare his righteousness: for God is judge himself. Selah.
Hear,*p O my people, and I will speak; O Israel, and I will testify against thee: I am God, even thy God.
I*p will not reprove thee for thy sacrifices or thy burnt offerings, to have been continually before me.
I*p will take no bullock out of thy house, nor he goats out of thy folds.
For*p every beast of the forest is mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills.
I*p know all the fowls of the mountains: and the wild beasts of the field are mine.
If*p I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine, and the fulness thereof.
Will*p I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
Offer*p unto God thanksgiving; and pay thy vows unto the most High:
And*p call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliver thee, and thou shalt glorify me.
But*p unto the wicked God saith, What hast thou to do to declare my statutes, or that thou shouldest take my covenant in thy mouth?
Seeing*p thou hatest instruction, and castest my words behind thee.
When*p thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and hast been partaker with adulterers.
Thou*p givest thy mouth to evil, and thy tongue frameth deceit.
Thou*p sittest and speakest against thy brother; thou slanderest thine own mother's son.
These*p things hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest that I was altogether such an one as thyself: but I will reprove thee, and set them in order before thine eyes.
Now*p consider this, ye that forget God, lest I tear you in pieces, and there be none to deliver.
Whoso*p offereth praise glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth his conversation aright will I shew the salvation of God.
